articles.author: Sarah Marsh
articles.description: The far-right AfD likely will score its best ever result as Europe's ailing economic powerhouse lurches rightwards. The conservative CDU/CSU bloc is set to win, but will be unlikely to secure a majority.
articles.title: Gloomy Germans vote in election which conservatives are set to win

articles.author: Jason Lange, Bo Erickson
articles.description: A notable portion of Trump's 2024 voters broke with some of the president's early actions and ideas, including the proposal to end birthright citizenship and moves to end diversity, equity, and inclusion initiatives.
articles.title: Trump gets middling grades on Americans' top issues, Reuters/Ipsos poll finds

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Pope Francis, who is battling double pneumonia in hospital, had a "tranquil" night and rested, the Vatican said on Sunday.
articles.title: Pope Francis had 'tranquil' night in hospital, Vatican says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Tens of thousands of people gathered on the outskirts of Beirut on Sunday to pay their respects to Hezbollah's slain leader Hassan Nasrallah, nearly five months after he was killed in an Israeli airstrike in a stunning blow to the Iran-backed group.
articles.title: Tens of thousands mourn Hezbollah's slain leader Nasrallah in mass funeral

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russian and U.S. teams plan to meet this week to discuss improving relations after the war in Ukraine had pushed ties to the worst level since the depths of the Cold War, a senior Russian start diplomat said on Sunday.
articles.title: Russia and US plan another meeting this week

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Ukraine's President Volodymyr Zelenskiy said on Sunday that Russia launched more than 200 drones in an overnight attack, the largest of the war, as he condemned Russia's "aerial terror" and called for unity among Ukraine's allies.
articles.title: Russia launches war's largest drone attack on Ukraine, Kyiv says

articles.author: Kanishka Singh
articles.description: President Donald Trump's special envoy Steve Witkoff and Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent said on Sunday they expected that an agreement would be signed this week on U.S. access to Ukraine's critical mineral deposits.
articles.title: US expects mineral deal with Ukraine to be signed this week

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The White House said on Sunday that it supports Israel's decision to delay releasing 600 Palestinian prisoners, citing the "barbaric treatment" of Israeli hostages by Hamas.
articles.title: White House backs Israel's decision to delay releasing Palestinian prisoners

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Talks with Israel through mediators on further steps in a ceasefire agreement are conditional on Palestinian prisoners being released as agreed, Hamas official Basem Naim said on Sunday.
articles.title: Hamas says talks with Israel contingent on release of prisoners as agreed

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Britain's Business and Trade Secretary Jonathan Reynolds and India's Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal will meet in New Delhi on Monday to restart talks on a UK-India trade deal, the British government said on Sunday.
articles.title: Britain and India to restart trade talks in New Delhi on Monday
